data.title: Need coffee?
data.text:
Coffee is something my body requires. Without it, I am useless. Most mornings you'll find me seeking out a large black iced coffee so that I can function. Recently I found myself in Gulfport early one Sunday and I discovered this PJ's. 

PJ's is a chain well known to New Orleanians. It is very fitting that there is one on the gulf coast as I'd guess half the residents hail from Louisiana. Compared to other locations, this PJ's is larger than most. It's located in the historic part of old Gulfport and the building has a lot of charm. There are lots of places to sit and it appeared to be a great place to do some work if I was so inclined.

The coffee here was consistent with what you find at other locations. My iced coffee was smooth with the hint of bitterness I enjoy. Service was friendly, but there was only one employee working when we arrived. While my iced coffee was easy to make, the kids' fru fru drinks took a bit longer. Had there been another employee it could of sped up the process.

This is a solid place to get coffee in Gulfport. If you need your coffee like I do, this should be on your list of places to stop.

data.title: Delicious Coffee / OK Service
data.text: For some reason, this PJs always seems under-staffed. There were over a dozen customers in this shop, and ONLY ONE EMPLOYEE working. I am not sure if this is a PJs policy, but it is frustrating to the customers. The coffee was superb, and the young lady was doing her best.

data.title: Getting better
data.text: There evidently has been a management change.  A few months I swore off PJ's.  I was in a hurry and dreadfully strolled in to get a bite.  I was pleasantly surprised that there were new employees.  Not perfect, but definitely getting better.  Keep heading in the right direction.

data.title: feels like home
data.text: Waiting on a meeting w Hancock Bank and spent 2 hours w the friendliest folks at PJ's.  What a great spot and the food, coffee /tea and service were exceptional. I have found a new home in Gulfport.. Special thanks to Shawn Howell.. What a great face man for a business .. He loves his job and shares that vibe w his customers..

data.title: So,  a full weekend sailing
data.text: I wake up 5pm Sunday morning after along weekend on the water and a great shower.  I pack my laptop and office work and walk over to one of the best coffee houses in the south.  To my surprise and dismay they don't open at this location until 8am. ; (   I ran across 3 couples looking for the same thing.  Hopefully, PJS Gulfport 49 can one day accommodate the early birds of the South soon.  Sidenote: I'd rather wait for PJS than go somewhere else.. so we are waiting;)

data.title: AMAZING Coffee Velvets
data.text: The closest PJs coffee is over an hour away; so, when we try to get away as a couple, we enjoy going to places that have PJ's. Today we took a date day to Gulfport/Biloxi. Since this is Mardi Gras season, we enjoy their Carnival blend and Mardi Gras blend coffee; so, we bought a pound of the Mardi Gras blend. We then order two large Mardi Gras coffee velvet ices which is their version of a frappe' but much smoother. The barrister we had was a little slow, and there were only two employees working with six or seven customers standing in line. We were not disappointed!

data.title: I often stop here for a mid day coffee
data.text: PJ's is a small chain from neighboring New Orleans.  Good local Coffee House.  They serve light lunches and snacks.

data.title: Good breakfast, great coffee and tea, lunch also!
data.text: Delicious breakfast sandwiches and really good coffee and tea as well.  Great wait staff, very friendly and helpful.  Good choice for breakfast or lunch!

data.title: Run away!
data.text: This is about the worst possible place to go in downtown.  I don't care if they are the only coffee shop.   If I need coffee that badly, I'll drive.  The service is about as poor as it gets.  The food is overpriced and tastes like it was baked weeks ago.   You'll be lucky if they have all the ingredients to make what you ordered.   Your best bet.......RUN AWAY!

data.title: The only choice!
data.text:
The coffee was bitter, and lukewarm, as was the service!
The girl behind the counter could hardly be bothered to serve us, and almost begrudgingly pushed our drinks at us!

data.title: Grinita coffee drink
data.text:
Thought the Granita was a little too liquid.
The ambiance is wonderful though. Will definitely return
And order other type of drink.

data.title: Nothing special, in fact it was rather blah.
data.text: Disappointing presentation and relatively high prices.  Napkins were out, half and half was out and a few of the tables seemed as though they had been left dirty for some time. The barista was nice enough and the location is excellent. Don't see a need to go back unless I met someone there during downtown business hours.

data.title: Laid Back
data.text: A nice place to have some good coffee and light food in old downtown Gulfport.  It's very laid back and people go there in the a.m. to do computer work and get ready for the day.  It's across the street from and old-fashioned drugstore and just a pleasant place.  A little pricey.

data.title: Really like this place
data.text: This is a very nice coffee shop for downtown gulfport.  I really like it and I would go there nearly every day, despite the fact that the company breakroom offered free coffee. Staff was friendly, seating was comfortable and the overall ambiance was really nice.  Free wifi did not disappoint.  I would definitely give this place a shot if I am in Gulfport and working nearby. Good coffee at a great value was also the order of the day.

data.title: Coffee in Gulfport
data.text: Have been coming to this coffee shop for several years, ech time I have been in gulfport. This year is was a bit of a disappointment. The service has slipped. The coffee was fine, but you can get good coffee at Starbucks or other places. They forgot to give my friend his hot chocolate, and we wondered where his order has gone. When they discovered the error, the drink was luke warm, but there was no offer to reheat it. Internet service was spotty and I was bumped off several times. Still, it remains popular.

data.title: Atmosphere and location
data.text: Along with the downtown central location this coffee shop has a very pleasant relaxed atmosphere.  The menu choices for a coffee shop are really great.  I will definitely make this a regular stop.

data.title: Perfect rest stop for a busy day
data.text: Last evening met a co-worker at PJ's. the restaurant is so quiet and relaxing it is the perfect place for an after work respite. Good coffee, lite snacks, comfortable atmosphere. What else would u want

data.title: cafeteria
data.text: Primeira vez que estava experimentando o café e a comida destra rede de cafeteria e achei bem básica.

data.title: sem grandes atrativos
data.text: Esta cafeteria fica no outlet de Gulfport. Parei para dar uma descansada enquanto tomava um café e comia um doce.
